section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਏਕੁ ਕੋਟੁ ਪੰਚ ਸਿਕਦਾਰਾ ਪੰਚੇ ਮਾਗਹਿ ਹਾਲਾ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In the one fortress of the body, there are five rulers, and all five demand payment of taxes.

transliteration.text: ēk kōt panch sikadārā panchē māgah hālā .

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਜਿਮੀ ਨਾਹੀ ਮੈ ਕਿਸੀ ਕੀ ਬੋਈ ਐਸਾ ਦੇਨੁ ਦੁਖਾਲਾ ॥੧॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I have not farmed anyone's land, so such payment is difficult for me to pay. ||1||

transliteration.text: jimī nāhī mai kisī kī bōī aisā dēn dukhālā .1.

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਹਰਿ ਕੇ ਲੋਗਾ ਮੋ ਕਉ ਨੀਤਿ ਡਸੈ ਪਟਵਾਰੀ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O people of the Lord, the tax-collector is constantly torturing me!

transliteration.text: har kē lōgā mō kau nīt dasai patavārī .

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

text: ਊਪਰਿ ਭੁਜਾ ਕਰਿ ਮੈ ਗੁਰ ਪਹਿ ਪੁਕਾਰਿਆ ਤਿਨਿ ਹਉ ਲੀਆ ਉਬਾਰੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raising my arms up, I complained to my Guru, and He has saved me. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: ūpar bhujā kar mai gur pah pukāriā tin hau līā ubārī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

text: ਨਉ ਡਾਡੀ ਦਸ ਮੁੰਸਫ ਧਾਵਹਿ ਰਈਅਤਿ ਬਸਨ ਨ ਦੇਹੀ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The nine tax-assessors and the ten magistrates go out; they do not allow their subjects to live in peace.

transliteration.text: nau dādī das munsaph dhāvah raīat basan n dēhī .

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

text: ਡੋਰੀ ਪੂਰੀ ਮਾਪਹਿ ਨਾਹੀ ਬਹੁ ਬਿਸਟਾਲਾ ਲੇਹੀ ॥੨॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: They do not measure with a full tape, and they take huge amounts in bribes. ||2||

transliteration.text: dōrī pūrī māpah nāhī bah bisatālā lēhī .2.

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

text: ਬਹਤਰਿ ਘਰ ਇਕੁ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸਮਾਇਆ ਉਨਿ ਦੀਆ ਨਾਮੁ ਲਿਖਾਈ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The One Lord is contained in the seventy-two chambers of the body, and He has written off my account.

transliteration.text: bahatar ghar ik purakh samāiā un dīā nām likhāī .

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

text: ਧਰਮ ਰਾਇ ਕਾ ਦਫਤਰੁ ਸੋਧਿਆ ਬਾਕੀ ਰਿਜਮ ਨ ਕਾਈ ॥੩॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The records of the Righteous Judge of Dharma have been searched, and I owe absolutely nothing. ||3||

transliteration.text: dharam rāi kā daphatar sōdhiā bākī rijam n kāī .3.

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

text: ਸੰਤਾ ਕਉ ਮਤਿ ਕੋਈ ਨਿੰਦਹੁ ਸੰਤ ਰਾਮੁ ਹੈ ਏਕੋੁ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Let no one slander the Saints, because the Saints and the Lord are as one.

transliteration.text: santā kau mat kōī nindah sant rām hai ēkō .

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.

text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਮੈ ਸੋ ਗੁਰੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਜਾ ਕਾ ਨਾਉ ਬਿਬੇਕੋੁ ॥੪॥੫॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, I have found that Guru, whose Name is Clear Understanding. ||4||5||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr mai sō gur pāiā jā kā nāu bibēkō .4.5.

melody.description: Suhi Lalit contains feelings of emotional resolve. However, there is also a volatile characteristic in that although there is love in these emotions, there is a willingness to step over the line to attain the goal.
